visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing monthly performance trends across three years using synthetic time-series data with seasonal patterns
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 3 annual series with 4 quarterly data points each, forming a 3x4 matrix of continuous financial metrics. Synthetic values were generated with 8-12% YoY growth patterns and Q4 seasonality, maintaining μ=4.85M, σ=0.75M across all years. Data ranges adhere to realistic corporate revenue scales with 15-20% quarter-over-quarter variance. The column chart maximizes data-ink ratio through clear value contrasts and temporal grouping. Color choices follow Cairo's preattentive processing principles using distinct hues with 60° separation on the color wheel. Stacked bars are avoided to prevent perceptual aggregation errors, while direct value encoding through height comparisons supports accurate magnitude estimation. Trend lines and 95% confidence intervals were omitted to focus on discrete period comparisons.
